entries.text: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Consecutive Sequence" and "Next Permutation". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 294

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Similar Dominos" and "Boomerang" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.
entries.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 293

entries.author: ali
entries.text: Yet another compact and elegant solutions in Perl. You must checkout if you are Perl fans.
entries.title: TWC293

entries.author: arne_sommer
entries.text: Cool use of subset of Raku giving us the elegant solutions. Great work, keep it up.
entries.title: Boomerang or Similar

entries.author: dave_jacoby
entries.text: Here is another gem from CPAN, Math::Trig. The end result is worth checking out. Thanks for sharing.
entries.title: Taking A New Angle

entries.author: jaldhar_vyas
entries.text: We all know the compact solution in Raku but replicating the same in Perl is awesome, very impressive. Keep sharing.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 293

entries.author: laurent_rosenfeld
entries.text: Comparative approach to a task in Perl and Raku is never to be missed. It always special for me. Thanks for sharing knowledge.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 293: Similar Dominoes

entries.author: luis_mochan
entries.text: Master of in-house Perl one-liners came up with yet another creative solution. Highly recommended.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 293

entries.author: matthias_muth
entries.text: Any maths lover? I am one, so loved the pure mathematical approach and narrative. Cool work, keep it up.
entries.title: Domino Frequencies and the Vectorized Boomerang

entries.author: packy_anderson
entries.text: Nice to see, how to deal edge cases. Very brave move and that too in multiple languages.
entries.title: Oh, oh, Domino!

entries.author: peter_campbell_smith
entries.text: Another mathematical angle to deal with Boomerang task. And on top, DIY tool is handy to play with.
entries.title: Matching and returning

entries.author: robbie_hatley
entries.text: Modularised approach makes the solution easy to read and follow. Short and concise narration comes handy. Great work.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge #293

entries.author: roger_bell_west
entries.text: Python is my new love and it doesn't take any effort to decode it. Credit goes to the master, Roger.
entries.title: Domino Boomerang

entries.text: Keep it sweet and simple, yet end up with classic end result. This is for both Perl and Python lovers.

chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Sajid Anwar will help you step out of your comfort-zone. You can even win prize money of $50 by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one champion at the end of the month from among all of the contributors during the month, thanks to the sponsor Lance Wicks.

header: Throughout the years I had many brilliant ideas regarding Perl and the Perl community that. I know they were brilliant because, as I found out later, they were already done by Dave Cross. This always gave me mixed feelings. On one hand it was always rather disappointing that my ideas weren't new or original. On the other hand it was of a great pride that my ideas aren't that dumb if Dave also had them.
Today I think I can celebrate. I think this is the first time where I had the idea (and the implementation) first.

In a recent article Dave writes about Advertising Perl. A very good idea to use the existing platforms to advertise Perl events. As I can see it is exactly 10 years after I announced shutting down the Perl Community Adserver. Wow, I am rather shocked that so many years have passed and unfortunately I can't find the posts in which I started to talk about it so I can't really verify the timeline.
In any case, I hope his attempt will be more successful than mine was.
subject: Advertising Perl
